description: This walk explores the grounds of Lough Rynn Castle in County Leitrim. The historic Irish Castle is surrounded by 350 acres of parkland and gardens making it ideal for an easy walk. There's sawmills, a farmyard, arboretum, green house, French stable yards, nature trails, and terraced gardens. Look out for the 400 year old oak tree, a bronze age tomb and the remains of a mediaeval castle. There's also views of the Rynn river which connects Lough Erril and Lough Rynn. The castle is now run as a hotel but you can visit for afternoon tea and enjoy a stroll around the grounds.
